snippet: After more than a year of fighting with Chinese government officials, the sons of two Americans killed in a train crash finally buried their parents in Queens.
abstract: Chinese-American brothers Henry and Leo Cao finally have a Queens burial for their parents, who were killed in a high-speed train crash in China in July 2011; the brothers spent more than a year fighting with Chinese government officials in a confusing and often maddening bureaucratic battle for adequate compensation and to bring their parents' bodies home.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and JEFFREY E. SINGER

lead_paragraph: After more than a year of fighting with Chinese government officials, the sons of two Americans killed in a train crash finally buried their parents in Queens.

headline.seo: Two Americans Buried in Queens After 2011 China Train Crash
headline.main: Two Americans Are Buried a Year After a Train Crash in China
headline.print_headline: Two Americans Are Buried Year After China Train Crash
